[[File:Adult teeth.png|neant|thumbnail]]

question.title: Question
question.description: What is the correct numbering system for primary teeth in children according to the international dental notation?

option_a.title: Option A
option_a.description: The primary teeth are numbered from 1 to 20, similar to adult teeth.

option_b.title: Option B
option_b.description: The primary teeth are numbered from 5 to 32, following a unique sequence for children.

option_c.title: Option C
option_c.description: The primary teeth are numbered from 1 to 32, the same as adult teeth, but with a different designation for baby teeth.

option_d.title: Option D
option_d.description: The primary teeth are numbered from 1 to 20, with each tooth assigned a unique number for identification.
